intro: Euonymus quelpaertensis, commonly known as the Jeju euonymus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Jeju in South Korea. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the humid subtropical climate of its native habitat. It is often found in forested areas and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
